alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coos; Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 2:52PM EST until January 14 at 3:45PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Coos County in northern New Hampshire... Central Grafton County in northern New Hampshire... Northern Carroll County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 345 PM EST. * At 251 PM EST, a dangerous area of snow squalls were located along a line extending from Dixville to 8 miles north of Tamworth, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 89 and 131. Locations impacted include... Conway, Berlin, Littleton, Lancaster, Bethlehem, Colebrook, Lincoln, Haverhill, Franconia, Errol, Pittsburg, Dixville, Woodstock, Stratford, Pinkham Notch, Piermont, Mount Washington, Tamworth, Sandwich, and Carroll. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
